h8002.definition: from {{h7999}}; properly, requital, i.e. a (voluntary) sacrifice in thanks; peace offering.

h8003.definition: from {{h7999}}; complete (literally or figuratively); especially friendly; full, just, made ready, peaceable, perfect(-ed), quiet, Shalem (by mistake for a name), whole.

h8004.definition: the same as {{h8003}}; peaceful; Shalem, an early name of Jerusalem; Salem.

h8006.definition: the same as {{h8005}}; Shillem, an Israelite; Shillem.

h8007.definition: probably for {{h8008}}; clothing; Salma, the name of two Israelites; Salma.

h8008.definition: transp. for {{h8071}}; a dress; clothes, garment, raiment.

h8009.definition: the same as {{h8008}}; clothing; Salmah, an Israelite; Salmon. Compare {{h8012}}.

h8010.definition: from {{h7965}}; peaceful; Shelomah, David's successor; Solomon.

h8012.definition: from {{h8008}}; investiture; Salmon, an Israelite; Salmon. Compare {{h8009}}.

h8013.definition: feminine plural of {{h7965}}; pacifications; Shelomoth, the name of two Israelites; Shelomith (from the margin), Shelomoth. Compare {{h8019}}.

h8014.definition: from {{h8008}}; clothed; Salmai, an Israelite; Shalmai.

h8015.definition: from {{h7965}}; peaceable; Shelomi, an Israelite; Shelomi.

h8016.definition: patronymically from {{h8006}}; a Shilemite (collectively) or descendants of Shillem; Shillemites.

h8017.definition: from {{h7965}} and {{h410}}; peace of God; Shelumiel, an Israelite; Shelumiel.

h8018.definition: or שֶׁלֶמְיָהוּ; from {{h8002}} and {{h3050}}; thank-offering of Jah; Shelemjah, the name of nine Israelites; Shelemiah.

h8019.definition: or שׁלוֹמִית; (Ezra 8:10), from {{h7965}}; peaceableness; Shelomith, the name of five Israelites and three Israelitesses; Shelomith.

h8020.definition: of foreign derivation; Shalman, a king apparently of Assyria; Shalman. Compare {{h8022}}.

h8022.definition: of foreign derivation; Shalmaneser, an Assyrian king; Shalmaneser. Comp {{h8020}}.

h8023.definition: the same as {{h7888}}; Shiloni, an Israelite; Shiloni.

h8024.definition: from {{h7956}}; a Shelanite (collectively), or descendants of Shelah; Shelanites.

h8025.definition: a primitive root; to pull out, up or off; draw (off), grow up, pluck off.

h8026.definition: from {{h8025}}; extract; Sheleph, a son of Jokthan; Sheleph.

h8027.definition: a primitive root perhaps originally to intensify, i.e. treble; but apparently used only as denominative from {{h7969}},; to be (causatively, make) triplicate (by restoration, in portions, strands, days or years); do the third time, (divide into, stay) three (days, -fold, parts, years old).

h8028.definition: from {{h8027}}; triplet; Shelesh, an Israelite; Shelesh.

h8029.definition: from {{h8027}}; a descendant of the third degree, i.e. great grandchild; third (generation).

h8030.definition: feminine from the same as {{h8028}}; triplication; Shilshah, an Israelite; Shilshah.

h8031.definition: feminine from {{h8027}}; trebled land; Shalishah, a place in Palestine; Shalisha.

h8032.definition: or שִׁלְשֹׁם; from the same as {{h8028}}; trebly, i.e. (in time) day before yesterday; before (that time, -time), excellent things (from the margin),   heretofore, three days,   time past.

h8033.definition: a primitive particle (rather from the relative pronoun, {{h834}}); there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence; in it,   thence, there (-in,   of,   out),   thither,   whither.

h8034.definition: a primitive word [perhaps rather from {{h7760}} through the idea of definite and conspicuous position; compare {{h8064}}]; an appellation, as a mark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character; base, (in-) fame(-ous), named(-d), renown, report.

h8035.definition: the same as {{h8034}}; name; Shem, a son of Noah (often includ. his posterity); Sem, Shem.

h8037.definition: from {{h8074}}; desolation; Shamma, an Israelite; Shamma.

h8038.definition: apparently from {{h8034}} and {{h83}}; name of pinion, i.e. illustrious; Shemeber, a king of Zeboim; Shemeber.

h8039.definition: perhaps for {{h8093}}; Shimah, an Israelite; Shimah. Compare {{h8043}}.

h8040.definition: or שְׂמֹאל; a primitive word (rather perhaps from the same as {{h8071}} (by insertion of the aleph) through the idea of wrapping up); properly, dark (as enveloped), i.e. the north; hence (by orientation), the left hand; left (hand, side).

h8041.definition: a primitive root (denominative from {{h8040}}); to use the left hand or pass in that direction; (go, turn) (on the, to the) left.

h8042.definition: from {{h8040}}; situated on the left side; left.

h8044.definition: of uncertain derivation; Shamgar, an Israelite judge; Shamgar.

h8045.definition: a primitive root; to desolate; destory(-uction), bring to nought, overthrow, perish, pluck down, × utterly.

h8047.definition: from {{h8074}}; ruin; by implication, consternation; astonishment, desolate(-ion), waste, wonderful thing.

h8048.definition: the same as {{h8047}}; Shammah, the name of an Edomite and four Israelites; Shammah.

h8049.definition: for {{h8048}}; desolation; Shamhuth, an Israelite; Shamhuth.

h8050.definition: from the passive participle of {{h8085}} and {{h410}}; heard of God; Shemuël, the name of three Israelites; Samuel, Shemuel.

h8051.definition: from {{h8074}}; renowned; Shammua, the name of four Israelites; Shammua, Shammuah.

h8052.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h8074}}; something heard, i.e. an announcement; bruit, doctrine, fame, mentioned, news, report, rumor, tidings.

h8053.definition: passive participle of {{h8103}}; observed; Shamur, an Israelite; Shamir (from the margin).

h8054.definition: plural of {{h8047}}; ruins; Shammoth, an Israelite; Shamoth.

h8055.definition: a primitive root; probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome; cheer up, be (make) glad, (have, make) joy(-ful), be (make) merry, (cause to, make to) rejoice, × very.

h8056.definition: from {{h8055}}; blithe or gleeful; (be) glad, joyful, (making) merry((-hearted), -ily), rejoice(-ing).

h8057.definition: from {{h8056}}; blithesomeness or glee, (religious or festival); × exceeding(-ly), gladness, joy(-fulness), mirth, pleasure, rejoice(-ing).

h8058.definition: a primitive root; to fling down; incipiently to jostle; figuratively, to let alone, desist, remit; discontinue, overthrow, release, let rest, shake, stumble, throw down.

h8059.definition: from {{h8058}}; remission (of debt) or suspension of labor); release.

h8060.definition: from {{h8073}}; destructive; Shammai, the name of three Israelites; Shammai.

h8061.definition: apparently from {{h8034}} and {{h3045}}; name of knowing; Shemida, an Israelite; Shemida, Shemidah.

h8062.definition: patronymically from {{h8061}}; a Shemidaite (collectively) or descendants of Shemida; Shemidaites.

h8063.definition: from {{h5564}}; a run (as sustaining the Oriental sitter); mantle.

h8064.definition: dual of an unused singular שָׁמֶה; from an unused root meaning to be lofty; the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve); air, × astrologer, heaven(-s).

h8067.definition: feminine of {{h8066}}; probably an eight-stringed lyre; Sheminith.

h8068.definition: from {{h8104}} in the original sense of pricking; a thorn; also (from its keenness for scratching) a gem, probably the diamond; adamant (stone), brier, diamond.

h8069.definition: the same as {{h8068}}; Shamir, the name of two places in Palestine; Shamir. Compare {{h8053}}.

h8070.definition: or שְׁמָרִימוֹת; probably from {{h8034}} and plural of {{h7413}}; name of heights; Shemiramoth, the name of two Israelites; Shemiramoth.

h8071.definition: perhaps by permutation for the feminine of {{h5566}} (through the idea of a cover assuming the shape of the object beneath); a dress, especially a mantle; apparel, cloth(-es, -ing), garment, raiment. Compare {{h8008}}.

h8072.definition: probably for the same as {{h8071}}; Samlah, an Edomite; Samlah.

h8073.definition: for {{h8014}}; Shamlai, one of the Nethinim; Shalmai (from the margin).

h8074.definition: a primitive root; to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense); make amazed, be astonied, (be an) astonish(-ment), (be, bring into, unto, lay, lie, make) desolate(-ion, places), be destitute, destroy (self), (lay, lie, make) waste, wonder.

h8077.definition: or שִׁמָמָה; feminine of {{h8076}}; devastation; figuratively, astonishment; (laid, × most) desolate(-ion), waste.

h8079.definition: probably from {{h8074}} (in the sense of poisoning); a lizard (from the superstition of its noxiousness); spider.

h8080.definition: a primitive root; to shine, i.e. (by analogy) be (causatively, make) oily or gross; become (make, wax) fat.

h8081.definition: from {{h8080}}; grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness; anointing, × fat (things), × fruitful, oil(-ed), ointment, olive,   pine.

h8082.definition: from {{h8080}}; greasy, i.e. gross; figuratively, rich; fat, lusty, plenteous.

h8083.definition: or שְׁמוֹנֶה; feminine שְׁמֹנָה; or שְׁמוֹנָה; apparently from {{h8082}} through the idea of plumpness; a cardinal number, eight (as if a surplus above the 'perfect' seven); also (as ordinal) eighth; eight(-een, -eenth), eighth.

h8084.definition: or שְׁמוֹנִים; multiple from {{h8083}}; eighty, also eightieth; eighty(-ieth), fourscore.

h8085.definition: a primitive root; to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.); × attentively, call (gather) together, × carefully, × certainly, consent, consider, be content, declare, × diligently, discern, give ear, (cause to, let, make to) hear(-ken, tell), × indeed, listen, make (a) noise, (be) obedient, obey, perceive, (make a) proclaim(-ation), publish, regard, report, shew (forth), (make a) sound, × surely, tell, understand, whosoever (heareth), witness.

h8087.definition: for the same as {{h8088}}; Shema, the name of a place in Palestine and of four Israelites; Shema.

h8088.definition: from {{h8085}}; something heard, i.e. a sound, rumor, announcement; abstractly, audience; bruit, fame, hear(-ing), loud, report, speech, tidings.

h8090.definition: for {{h8087}}; Shema, a place in Palestine; Shema.

h8091.definition: from {{h8085}}; obedient; Shama, an Israelite; Shama.

h8092.definition: for {{h8093}}; Shima, the name of four Israelites; Shimea, Shimei, Shamma.

h8093.definition: feminine of {{h8088}}; annunciation; Shimah, an Israelite; Shimeah.

h8095.definition: from {{h8085}}; hearing; Shimon, one of Jacob's sons, also the tribe descended from him; Simeon.

h8096.definition: from {{h8088}}; famous; Shimi, the name of twenty Israelites; Shimeah (from the margin), Shimei, Shimhi, Shimi.

h8097.definition: patronymically from {{h8096}}; a Shimite (collectively) or descendants of Shimi; of Shimi, Shimites.

h8098.definition: or שְׁמַעְיָהוּ; from {{h8085}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has heard; Shemajah, the name of twenty-five Israelites; Shemaiah.

h8099.definition: patronymically from {{h8095}}; a Shimonite (collectively) or descendants of Shimon; tribe of Simeon, Simeonites.

h8100.definition: feminine of {{h8088}}; annunciation; Shimath, an Ammonitess; Shimath.
